column1: Appeal. In fact, according to section 5A (2) statutory provisions that refer to the appellate procedure
in any written law applicable to the exercise of the jurisdiction referred to in subsection (1) by the
Court of Appeal, shall be read and construed as including a reference to a High Court established
by Article154P. This indicates that the Provincial High Court and Court of Appeal had parallel and
concurrent jurisdiction under section 5A (2) of the Act No. 54 of 2006 and that the appellate and
revisionary jurisdiction of the Court of Appeal was transferred to the Provincial High Court.
It is noteworthy that, Justice Salam in Stephan Gunaratne v. Thushara Indika Sampath (supra)
also referred to a similar purpose of the Act No. 54 of 2006,
